intro: Gravesia humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's gravesia, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
